poem:
Title: The Uninvited Lens

In Manchester's shadows, stolen glances,
Captured faces, unwilling dances.
Unsolicited, the spotlight finds the night,
In each pixel, a blatant slight.
Women urged to claim voices,
Stand against digital invasions, choices.
In the search for the faceless condemn,
Even darkness seeks light for them.
